greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle A135225 + A007318 - A103451, read by rows.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = A135225(n,k) + A007318(n,k) - A103451(n,k) as infinite lower triangular matrices.
T(n,k) = ((n+k)/n)*binomial(n,k) with T(n,0) = T(n,n) = 1. - _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..10); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
mathematica: T[n_, k_]:= T[n, k]= If[k==0 || k==n, 1, ((n+k)/n) Binomial[n, k]]; Table[T[n, k], {n,0,10}, {k,0,n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019 *)
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = if(k==0 || k==n, 1, ((n+k)/n)*binomial(n,k)); \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
T:= func< n,k | k eq 0 or k eq n select 1 else ((n+k)/n)*Binomial(n,k) >;
[T(n,k): k in [0..n], n in [0..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
[[T(n,k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..10)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
if k=0 or k=n then return 1;
Flat(List([0..10], n-> List([0..n], k-> T(n,k) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Nov 23 2007
ext: Corrected and extended by _Philippe Deléham_, Nov 14 2011
